page.title: 01General Review 04800411
page.content: The majority of the area is arable farmland except for Block Reference (Block Ref.) 04820411 which is a quarter occupied by the disused power station and Block Ref. 04830411 which is 50% the residential area of Keadby. The area is rich alluvial land drained and reclaimed in the C17 by a famous Dutch engineer Cornelius Vermuyden,in the face of bitter local opposition,encircled by the rivers Trent,Torne,Don and Idle. Previously the land had been unusable marshland which with the use of the high tide and a system of drains was made workable by depositing alluvium on the land.The area is owned by several farmers who also sub-let to others.Most of the farmhouses in the area have been demolished or sold off for private use.Crops grown in
